seriesJson.title: Your Congress today
seriesJson.description: This series explores the relationships between the Congress and the Supreme Court and the Presidency.

node.title: Congressman's constituency
node.description: House Speaker Sam Rayburn and Sen. Everett Dirksen discuss opinion polls and the wisdom of following the wishes of the majority.

node.title: Congressmen & administrative agencies
node.description: Rep. John McCormack ("There's a greater law than manmade law; there's the law of God") and Rep. William Bray ("We have found some agencies that certainly far outlived their usefulness for many years.")

node.title: Congressman & Supreme Court
node.description: Sen. James O. Eastland ("The court has wrapped a blanket of immunity around the Communist conspiracy in this country") and Sen. Wayne Morse

node.title: Congressman's constituency
node.description: House Speaker Sam Rayburn and Sen. Everett Dirksen discuss opinion polls and the wisdom of following the wishes of the majority.

node.title: Congressman's lobbies
node.description: Sen. Hubert Humphrey ("Any contribution to any lobby of $50 or more ought to be registered") and Sen. Homer E. Capehart

node.title: Congressman's party
node.description: Sen. Frank Lausche ("Never oppose a cause that is good even though it is sponsored by the opposing political party...) and Rep. Charles Halleck

node.title: Congressman & President
node.description: This program presents interviews with Senator Richard Russell ("Congress has lost a great deal of prestige over the past 25 years") and Representative Joseph W. Martin ("Pres. Eisenhower is not the forceful, fighting type of either of the Roosevelts").
